member.summary: Configuration for padding defaults in comments.

member.summary: The default padding between the comment character (; or #) and the start of the comment text. Defaults to 1.

member.name: T:IniFile.Config.HashCommentConfig
member.summary: Configuration on whether the hash symbol (#) can be used for comments.

member.name: P:IniFile.Config.HashCommentConfig.Allow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether comments prefixed with a hash (#) symbol are allowed, in addition to the standard semi-colon ones.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether comments are to be prefixed with a hash (#) symbol by default, instead of the standard semi-colon.
Note that semi-colon prefixed comments will still be allowed.

member.name: T:IniFile.Config.IniGlobalConfig

member.summary: Configuration for using hash symbols (#) for comments in INI files.

member.summary: Configuration for padding defaults for sections, properties and comments in INI files.

member.name: P:IniFile.Config.IniGlobalConfig.Types

member.summary: Allows the hash symbol (#) to be used to prefix comments.

member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: M:IniFile.Config.IniGlobalConfig.SetBooleanStrings(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the default string values to represent true and false when writing boolean properties.

member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.summary: Sets the default date and time formats when reading and writing and values.
member.param: The format for dates. If this value is null, then the current culture short date format is used.
member.returns: The same instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

member.name: T:IniFile.Config.SectionPaddingConfig

member.summary: The default padding between the opening square bracket of a section and the start of the section name. Default is 0.

member.name: P:IniFile.Config.SectionPaddingConfig.InsideRight
member.summary: The default padding between the end of the section name and the closing square bracket of a section. Default is 0.

member.name: T:IniFile.ErrorMessages
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.CannotCastPropertyValue
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot convert the property value to a {0}..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.IniFileDoesNotExist
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The INI file '{0}' does not exist..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.InvalidMajorItemName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified name is not valid. A valid name can start with any alphabetic character, period (.), dollar symbol ($) or semi-colon (:) and can be followed by one or more alpha-numeric characters, underscores (_), tilde (~), dash (-), period (.), semi-colon (:), dollar symbol ($), or space..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.PropertyWithoutSection
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The property '{0}' is not in a section. This is not allowed; all properties must be specified under a section..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.StreamNotReadable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified stream is not readable (CanRead = false). The INI content cannot be loaded from it..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.StreamNotWritable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified stream is not writable (CanWrite = false). The INI object cannot be saved to it..

member.name: P:IniFile.ErrorMessages.UnrecognizedLine
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An unrecognized line was encountered in the INI content. {0}.

summary.para: In-memory object representation of an INI file.
This class is a read-only collection of objects.

member.summary: Transforms the INI content into an in-memory object model.

member.summary: Read all lines from the given text reader, parse and generate INI objects such as section, properties, comments and blank lines.
member.param: The instance to read the INI lines from.

member.name: M:IniFile.Ini.CreateObjectModel(IniFile.IniLoadSettings,System.Collections.Generic.IList{IniFile.Items.IniItem})
member.summary: Go through each line object and construct a hierarchical object model, with properties under sections and comments/blank lines under respective sections and properties.
member.param: The INI load settings that control the load behavior.

Collection of strings that represent the comments and blank lines of the property. If the string is null, an empty string or a whitespace string, then a object is created, otherwise a is created.

member.summary: The symbol used to denote the end of a multi-line value.

member.summary: Padding details of this .

summary.para: Represents the value of a property
Property values can be strings, numbers (both floats and integers), date/times and booleans.

member.name: F:IniFile.PropertyValue._value
member.summary: The value of the property, internally using the actual type.

summary.para: The string representation of the value. This is used if the string representation is different from the string returned by calling _value.ToString().
Boolean values use this, as there can be multiple string representations of a boolean value such as 0, on, etc.

member.name: M:IniFile.PropertyValue.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the structure.
member.param: The value to initialize the property with. If null, the type is considered a string.

member.name: M:IniFile.PropertyValue.#ctor(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the structure where the string representation of the underlying object is different from the string representation of the value in the INI file.
member.param: The value to initialize the property with. If null, the type is considered a string.
The different string representation of the value in the INI file.

member.name: M:IniFile.PropertyValue.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string value, if it exists, otherwise returns the result of the object value. If the object value is null, then the returned value is also null.
member.returns: String that represents the current property value.

member.name: M:IniFile.PropertyValue.AsDateTime(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Returns the property value as a .
member.param: A format specifier that defines the required format of the property string value.

member.returns: The property value as the specified enum.
